intro: Desmos macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered desmos, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a leathery texture. Desmos macrocalyx is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
